name: Undergraduate Research Assistant
company: Computational Ecology Lab at UC Santa Cruz
description: I performed research in efficient connectivity computation for bird species in Python/PyTorch and R, building methods for processing geospatial data and automating input layer generation for our novel connectivity computation algorithm.

name: Lead Web Developer
company: Tech4Good Lab at UC Santa Cruz
description: Over several academic quarters, I led 50+ students in learning web development by collaboratively building web applications for research initiatives in social computing.

name: Software Engineering Intern
description: I participated in two internships at JPL, in which I worked with the Deep Space Network Emulator (DSNE) team to produce automation software for creating DSNE configuration files and test scripts.

name: Google Summer of Code Mentor
company: UC Santa Cruz Open Source Program Office (UCSC OSPO)
description: I mentored two Google Summer of Code participants in building Causeway, a web application that teaches learners web development using a microrole-based structure, and Compass Goals, one of the exemplar application used in Causeway.

name: Pintos Projects
description: I collaborated with a partner on Stanford's Pintos projects, which involved implementation of support for user programs, virtual memory, and file systems in an existing operating system.

name: Kakaw!
description: I worked in a team of six to produce Kakaw!, an application that facilitates learning and review via live quiz sessions.
